perturbation.original_text:
THIS AGREEMENT made effective the 10 day of January 2019 (the "Effective Date"),

BETWEEN:

EMERALD HEALTH NATURALS, INC., a company having its registered and records office at 7860 Venture Street, Burnaby, BC V5A 1V3

("Emerald" or the "Company")

AND:

DR. GAETANO MORELLO N.D. INC., Businessperson, having an office at 2975 East 4th Avenue, Vancouver, B.C. V5M 1L1

(the "Contractor")
perturbation.changed_text:
THIS AGREEMENT made effective the 10 day of January 2019 (the "Effective Date"),

BETWEEN:

EMERALD HEALTH NATURALS, INC., a company having its registered and records office at 7860 Venture Street, Burnaby, BC V5A 1V3

("Emerald" or the "Corporation")

AND:

DR. GAETANO MORELLO N.D. INC., Businessperson, having an office at 2975 East 4th Avenue, Vancouver, B.C. V5M 1L1

(the "Service Provider")
perturbation.explanation: The terms "Company" and "Contractor" are replaced with "Corporation" and "Service Provider" respectively. While seemingly minor, this change creates ambiguity as later sections of the contract refer to both "Company" and "Contractor". It's now unclear if these terms are interchangeable with "Corporation" and "Service Provider", potentially leading to disputes over which entity bears certain responsibilities defined elsewhere in the agreement.

perturbation.original_text:
3.1 Fee. The Company will pay to the Contractor an annual fee (the "Fee") of $240,000. per year plus plus GST and applicable taxes, if any.





3.2 Reimbursement of Expenses. Emerald will reimburse the Contractor for all reasonable expenses incurred in the performance of his or her Services, provided that the Contractor provides a written expense account in a form satisfactory to the Lead Director of the Company.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.1 Compensation. The Corporation will pay to the Service Provider an annual compensation (the "Compensation") of $240,000. per year plus plus GST and applicable taxes, if any.





3.2 Reimbursement of Expenses. Emerald will reimburse the Consultant for all reasonable expenses incurred in the performance of his or her Services, provided that the Consultant provides a written expense account in a form satisfactory to the Lead Director of the Company.
perturbation.explanation: Here, "Fee" is changed to "Compensation" and "Contractor" is changed to "Consultant". Using multiple terms for the same concept (payment) creates confusion. Further, the introduction of 'Consultant' when the agreement preamble defines only 'Service Provider' increases the ambiguity. Does 'Consultant' have the same rights and obligations as the 'Service Provider'? This discrepancy could lead to disputes over expense reimbursement and other obligations tied to 'Contractor' but not explicitly extended to 'Consultant'.

perturbation.original_text:
5.3 Emeralds' Right to Terminate this Agreement for Cause. The Company may terminate this Agreement and the Contractor's engagement for Cause at any time on written notice to the Contractor. The date of termination will be the date specified in the written notice and may be, in the sole discretion of the Company, the same day the notice is given to the Contractor, or such later date as the Company may decide.

5.4 Emeralds' Right to Terminate this Agreement without Cause. The Company may terminate this Agreement and the engagement of the Contractor without Cause at any time on 30 days prior written notice. The date of termination will be the date specified in the written notice and must be a date, which is not earlier than the required notice period.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.3 Emeralds' Right to Terminate this Agreement for Cause. The Corporation may terminate this Agreement and the Service Provider's engagement for Cause at any time on written notice to the Consultant. The date of termination will be the date specified in the written notice and may be, in the sole discretion of the Corporation, the same day the notice is given to the Service Provider, or such later date as the Corporation may decide.

5.4 Emeralds' Right to Terminate this Agreement without Cause. The Corporation may terminate this Agreement and the engagement of the Consultant without Cause at any time on 30 days prior written notice. The date of termination will be the date specified in the written notice and must be a date, which is not earlier than the required notice period.
perturbation.explanation: This perturbation uses the changed terms from earlier perturbations ("Corporation" for "Company", "Service Provider" for "Contractor", and the introduction of "Consultant") within the context of termination rights. Now, the section is internally inconsistent. Does the Corporation have the right to terminate the Consultant's services as per the original intention of terminating the Contractor? Given the prior changes, it could be argued that the termination clause only applies to the Consultant, not the originally intended Contractor or Service Provider.
